result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua Dale Puotinen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Joshua Dale Puotinen is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Joshua Dale Puotinen was found guilty of Possess Drug Paraphernalia [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).
  • Joshua Dale Puotinen was found guilty of Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: as a Party to a Crime

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent without prejudice to consecutive if revoked.
Court dismisses Counts 1 and 3.
Defendant to report to Probation by Friday September 18, 2015.
Court will consider expungement pending successful completion of Probation.
Attorney Amann to verify credit.

  

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with:

miscConds.notes:
Apply bond on file.
DNA surcharge.

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Random and regular testing.
-Court recommends Defendant obtaining his GED.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson.ADA:  Edward Minser DF ATTY:  T Gregory Amann   DF:  Joshua Dale Puotinen appeared. Case called at 3:16. ADA Minser updates the court. There has been an amended information filed.  Atty. Amann agrees.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to the amended information Ct 2,4  in14CF83. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 2,4 in the amended information of 14CF83. On motion of the State without objection, Crt dismisses Ct 1, 3 in the amended information in 14CF83. Sentencing arguments. Crt orders:  Sentence I/S on Ct. 2 -30 days St. Croix County Jail STAYED. Ct. 4- 30 days St. Croix County Jail STAYED Consecutive.
- 18 mo. probation with conditions
     Probation is concurrent without prejudice to consecutive sentencing in the event of Probation revocation.
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times 
  This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- AODA and any recommended follow through. 
- Costs of both counts.
   Apply bond on file. 
- Random and regular testing. 
- Court recommends DE to obtain GED.
Court notes request for expungement  court will consider expungement pending successful completion of probation.   
Atty. Amann to verify credit. 
DE to report to probation by Fri. 09-18-2015.

Jury trial on September 28, 2015 at 08:00 am.
Final pre-trial on September 16, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
